alert.note: Alert for Pleasants; Tyler (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 04 at 10:06PM EST until February 05 at 9:00AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Creek and river flooding caused by runoff from prior excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern West Virginia, including the following counties, Pleasants and Tyler. * WHEN...Until 400 AM EST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 958 PM EST, stream gauges along the Middle Island Creek indicate moderate flooding is occurring due to runoff from earlier rains. - The creek level should continue to slowly fall over the next several hours. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... St. Marys, Middlebourne, Wick, Arvilla and Point Lookout. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Report Severe Weather to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
